data.title: Terrible Italian food
data.text: I have been to this restaurant many times as my company seems to have a fascination with it.  Every time I visit corporate as part of a group, they bring us there.  The food is terrible.  Service is usually ok but I would never chose to go here.  They seem to believe garlic makes food Italian.  Way over used in their recipes. Unfortunately, I'll probably end up here again sometime when visiting HQ.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We are sorry to hear about your recent experience, this is certainly not the impression we want our guests to leave with. We pride ourselves in delivering great service, food, and overall dining atmosphere. We really do appreciate your feedback and hope you give us the chance to make it right! Please reply to my direct message so we can reach out to you.
Thank you
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fun Dining
data.text: The decor and ambience were superb!  Our server (Vanessa) was very friendly and pleasant.  Our food was delivered to our table in a reasonable amount of time, given that everything was made to order. The antipasto salad (chopped), the marsala sauce, the garlic mashed potatoes, and the mushrooms were delicious and of generous portions.  We were disappointed however, in the taste/quality of the bread (served before our entrees arrived) and the taste of our red Sangria (somewhat bitter).  Also, the veal was not very tender nor flavorful. The amount of veal sufficed for two people, but would have been insufficient for three.  Overall, it was a fun dining experience.

data.title: Great lunch
data.text:
Everything was perfect. Food --- chicken, eggplant Parmigiana both excellent and were cooked to order. Good bread, green beans and Alfredo, marinara sauces also.
I understand night time is family style, but you could go in bar (table) and order the 
individual items.  May be favorite lunch place while we are in area.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the positive review! We hope to see you for lunch soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Salad for lunch
data.text: My wife and I used to stop here often for a caesar salad with extra anchovies. Now there are no anchovies and it costs twice as much. We added chicken breast for $6 and got very little tasteless rubber chicken. Used to love Buca, but this time was very disappointed.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Please accept our apologies, the last thing we want is to disappoint our customers. We would really like a chance to make things right. If you could please send us a message with your contact information we will reach out to you.
Thank you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lunch is always great
data.text: This place seems to be forgotten about as a lunch spot.  I will say...  if you need a place to sit down for lunch and not worry about not getting a table.. go here.  Lunch menu is fantastic and priced right.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to write this review as it means a lot to us. We hope to see you for lunch again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Way Over Priced
data.text: Food is very expensive and is very bland.  Used to use it for business lunches but the prices hot straight through the roof and the food got very bland.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We appreciate you taking the time to write this review as our customers feedback means a lot to us. I am sorry to hear our food was not up to our usual standards and although our pricing is based on the large portions we serve we would like a chance to change your mind and make things right. If you could please reply to my private message we will contact you.
Thank you
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Consistently performing semi-local chain
data.text:
We have been to this Buca location many times over the years, as a couple, with more of the family, for work holiday parties, etc. The service is consistently friendly and the food is consistently good. I especially like the sangria (red AND white) and recommend getting the carafe instead of just one glass. There's not usually much of a wait for a table, though parking can be an issue as the lot is too small (they do offer valet). The complimentary bread has changed (it's probably been a few years since that occurred) and is not as good as what it used to be, but otherwise I can't think of anything I didn't like. Portions are meant to be shared family-style which can be fun if you and your family like the same things, and frustrating if you have picky eaters! 

Some food highlights: the pizza bianca, penne san remo, and rigatoni. Additional non-food highlight: Buca restaurants always have very fun decor, especially in the bathrooms. 

Tip: Buca has a great lunch menu - very affordable pricing for soup, salad, pasta - and in single-person portions!

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear you have visited Buca di Beppo many times and hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Always great, eggplant is awesome !
data.text: This place is always great, not sure what some other reviews are staying about being unhygienic and the food being too large, but this is the style of restaurant and there is nothing wrong with it. Food is always very good, one here we would never return to the dreaded Olive Garden, yuck. Prices with a coupon are excellent for what you get and quality. This location is our favourite. Eggplant Parmigiana is our favourite.Free bread with oil and vinegar to dip is also excellent.Try it with an open mind, you will love it !

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Ciao! We are glad to hear you enjoy Buca di Beppo and hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Consistently Average
data.text:
Service at Buca is very good and friendly but they need some more options - how about a Gorgonzola sauced dish? Or even build your own pasta with more options; i.e. sauces, meats/shrimp, veggies, pasta choice, etc...?

We had the Veal Saltimbocca, Veal Parmigiana and Spaghetti Marinara with a meatball. All were good but nothing to rush back for. Tiramisu was also average. Portions are generous.

data.title: Amazing
data.text: The best food, wine, service and atmosphere, EVER.  Salads are excellent, all pasta dishes and chicken Marsala are excellent.  Fun for a birthdat, the wait staff sing to you.

owner_response.author: bucalove, Guest Relations Manager at Buca di Beppo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are happy to hear of the great time you had at Buca di Beppo.  We do love singing happy birthday! We look forward to celebrating with you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not What it used to be
data.text: Usually we really enjoy Buca, but this time was a not one of them. Service was poor. Food as not a hot as it should have been. Salad was missing ingredients. Then to top it off we were over charged.  Doubt we'll be back any time soon.

data.title: A great experience
data.text: We hit the mall of America for the weekend.  I took my son and his family out for dinner to buca di beppo.  He absolutely loved it.  I think we tried about half the menu.  We had the bruschetta, and insalata caprese for apps.  Both were good.  We tried the shrimp florentine pasta and manicotti for our main course.  Those were very good, especially the shrimp.  We also had a side of meatballs and a small pizza.  Both were good.  Our waitress was the best.  I believe her name was Jenna.  She even brought the pope to our table so we could take pictures with him.  We had a blast.  People here were great!!!!!

data.title: Sunday night home-cooked Italian like Mama used to make
data.text: We made reservations in advance.  Old world decor with character.  Friendly wait staff.  Snappy service.  Bruschetta app was delicious.  Chicken Saltimbocca and Baked Ziti were made to perfection.  More than enough food for four people.  Food prep, quality and presentation is superb.  Atmosphere is friendly and cozy.  Loved the personality.  Tiramisu is plentiful and tasty.  Will return.  Four people with a couple of beers and Pellegrino was 125.  Shout out to Nicolle, our waitress.  Fantastic!

data.title: A LITTLE THEATER OF ITALIAN EATING......AN "EVENT" RESTAURANT DESTINATION
data.text:
THINK OF YOUR IDEA OF A SMALL CLICHE ITALIAN VILLAGE RESTAURANT....this is it ! ...more theater event than food focus, but it is advertised as an "event" destination for birthday parties, bachelorette dinners, anniversaries, team or award dinners,etc.

LOCATION: Easy to find, at the intersection of Hwy 212 and Mitchell Road in suburban Eden Prairie in a mall like building. There ample parking in front. Entry thru the only doors is directly into the kitchen of the restaurant....don't worry this is part of the show. We were escorted thru a series of small rooms then into seating areas. Walls covered with small framed portraits and black/white pictures of what you might imagine to be Italian genre and scenes. Walls are dark red, furniture dark and the 
requisite red/white checkered table clothes cover large tables with many chairs per table...this is a place for large groups.
      
MENU:   An ample drink/wine menu focuses on Italian wines, beers and drinks (although there appears to be no espresso coffee available !!!!) A fairly abbreviated dinner menu covers the usual pizza, pasta, antipasta, soups,etc. The menu content is heavy on chicken and pasta, although several house specialties are listed, some salads and a few vegetables. Breads are a focus. It is the appetizers that offer the more originality. We had mussels with two different sauces. When we inquired about origins we were told "unknown" since they come in frozen bags from distributor !. There really is no clue as to the origins or ingredients of menu foods. There is almost no disclosure or even use of spices or herbs. Nothing is advertised as organic or gluten free. No caloric counts on menus. Its all a mystery.
    The second noticeable feature here is the size of the portions. It is definitely a "throwback" to 1980's giant portions and heaps of food on large plates. Here on the menu it discloses there are two sizes of portioning "small" serving 1-3 people and "large" serving 4-7+. Food is served on platters, not plates. Individual plates are available, but customers are encouraged to "dig in" and serve themselves from the massive platters. Very communal, perhaps not hygienic. The results are not artful.

SERVICE: Hostesses and servers are very friendly and knowledgeable about their menus. While a bit slow in serving, they seem genuinely interested in pleasing customers.  
TAKEAWAY.....Good idea for a fun restaurant whose menu is stuck back in 1980's. A fresh update in menu, plates, services and portion size would do wonders here.

SUMMARY: A good place for a multigenrational dining experience-but not a good choice for lighter, more modern food tastes.

data.title: Great but getting more expensive
data.text: As always the food was great. Service was a little slow and not as attentive as usual. Also they have changed the menu and as always prices went up.

data.title: Family Table Style
data.text: Stopped in on a Friday night and had about a 30 min wait. Food was taste and hot. wines very good. service was a little on the slow side. The food is served family style. The inside has Italian décor everywhere and a little noisy. Has a great experience

data.title: "Was your food hot?"
data.text: Stopped for a late lunch on a Saturday.  No lunch menu offered on a Saturday so we ordered family sized Fettuccini Alfredo with added chicken and prosciutto stuffed chicken (We usually get the chicken parmesan, but wanted to try something different and we were very pleased with the stuffed chicken).  Waiting for our waitress was painfully long.  Finally we were able to order.  We watched another table with a different waitress get seated, get their drinks and bread before our waitress came back to tell us they were out of fettuccini noodles and would we like to wait for fettuccini noodles or take a different noodle for our fettuccini Alfredo?  Hungry, we said, yes, we'd take anything and we would also like our bread.  Everything came at once a few minutes later.  Our waitress disappeared and left us plate-less and with no silverware.  It was also self serve on the refills of water as we were forced to help ourselves to the pitcher sitting behind us on a ledge.  A manager (?) came by and asked us how we liked our food.  We said it was good.  He asked "was it hot?"  Not sure why he'd ask that.  We were quite hungry and ate it right away and don't remember having "hot" food, but food that was at least edible.  Due to the service given to us here, we won't choose this eatery again.  There is too much competition in Eden Prairie to make us want to be treated like this.

data.title: The desert tried to save this from being terrible
data.text: Had a decent sized coupon so decided to try this again after not going for a few years.  Food was below average.  First lets start with the appetizer, we ordered cheese bread.  Don't bother with that, very poor!  For dinner we had the driest fettuccini I have ever had.  We actually had to ask the server for more sauce.  The brought what seemed to be a large bowl but didn't help enough.  We also had chicken parmigiana which was ok, but nothing special.  For desert we had the Cheesecake which if you have never had is worth the trip just for desert.  We learned our lesson, there are far better places out there for this type of food.  We might be back to grab a cheesecake to go, but I don't think we will be eating there again anytime soon.  Even with our coupon it was ridiculously expensive.  For the prices they charge I would expect it to be much better!

data.title: Family Friendly
data.text: It's probably the best family table 'style American-Italian restaurants here in and outside of the Twin Cities, with the portion sizes to match. They have a pretty friendly staff that will happily explain the menu and style of serving they have. They also have a pretty decent wine collection. Their walls are filled with unique art, while also displaying many pics of famous Italians and ads dating all the way back to the 1950's-60's. If you are looking for a place for big groups and really good food and not so boring, then this is the spot.

data.title: Fabulous Italian Cuisine
data.text: Authentic Italian food is what you will be served at Buca di Beppo. This restaurant is serious about serving large appetites. The food is cooked to perfection and the staff is friendly.
